questions.question: What does a yellow diamond-shaped sign indicate?
questions.explanation: A yellow diamond-shaped sign indicates warning or caution, often for upcoming road conditions.

questions.question: What does a red octagonal sign mean?
questions.explanation: A red octagonal sign is always a stop sign.

questions.question: At an intersection with a flashing yellow light, you should:
options: Wait for the light to turn green
questions.explanation: A flashing yellow light means proceed with caution, not stop or yield.

questions.question: When two drivers arrive at a four-way stop at the same time, who has the right-of-way?
questions.explanation: At a four-way stop, if two vehicles arrive simultaneously, the vehicle on the right has the right-of-way.

questions.question: What is the maximum speed limit on most Illinois highways if not posted otherwise?
questions.explanation: In Illinois, the maximum speed limit on most highways is 55 mph unless otherwise posted.

questions.question: When parking uphill with a curb, you should turn your wheels:
questions.explanation: When parking uphill with a curb, turn your wheels away from the curb so your vehicle will roll into the curb if the brakes fail.

questions.question: During a snowstorm, you should:
questions.explanation: During a snowstorm, you should decrease your speed to maintain control of your vehicle.

questions.question: What is the minimum following distance in normal weather conditions?
questions.explanation: In normal weather conditions, you should maintain a minimum following distance of three seconds.

questions.question: What should you do if your car starts to skid?
options: Steer in the opposite direction of the skid
Steer in the direction you want to go
questions.correctAnswer: Steer in the direction you want to go
questions.explanation: If your car starts to skid, you should steer in the direction you want to go and not brake or accelerate.

questions.question: When are you allowed to park in a handicap parking space?
options: If you are picking up a person with a disability
If you have a disability and have a permit
If all other parking spaces are full
questions.correctAnswer: If you have a disability and have a permit
questions.explanation: Handicap parking spaces are reserved for people with disabilities who have a permit.
